cards.name: Alaka
cards.text: If you have used a creature to fight this turn, Alaka enters play ready.

cards.name: Alaka’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Ballcano
cards.text: Play: Deal 4D to each creature. Gain 2 chains.

cards.name: Barn Razing
cards.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, your opponent loses 1A each time a friendly creature fights.

cards.name: Berserker Slam
cards.text: Play: Deal 4D to a flank creature. If this damage destroys that creature, its controller loses 1A.

cards.name: Cowfyne
cards.text: Before Fight: Deal 2D to each neighbor of the creature Cowfyne fights.

cards.name: Ganger Chieftain
cards.text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.

cards.name: Groke
cards.text: Fight: Your opponent loses 1A.

cards.name: Gron Nine-Toes
cards.text: Gron Nine-Toes gets +4 power while it is damaged. (Gron Nine-Toes gets the power bonus only if he survives the damage.)

cards.name: Irestaff
cards.text: Action: Enrage a creature. Give that creature a +1 power counter.

cards.name: Mogghunter
cards.text: Fight: Deal 2D to a flank creature.

cards.name: Narp
cards.text: Narp’s neighbors cannot reap.

cards.name: Shorty
cards.text: Assault 4. (Before this creature attacks, deal 4D to the attacked enemy.)Reap: Enrage Shorty.

cards.name: Stilt-Kin
cards.text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)After a Giant creature is played adjacent to Stilt-Kin, ready and fight with Stilt-Kin.

cards.name: Tremor
cards.text: Play: Stun a creature and each of its neighbors.

cards.name: Warriors’ Refrain
cards.text: Play: Stun each creature with power 3 or lower.

cards.name: Blood Money
cards.text: Play: Place 2A from the common supply on an enemy creature.

cards.name: Flamethrower
cards.text: Action: Deal 1D to a creature, with 1D splash.

cards.name: Flamewake Shaman
cards.text: Play: Deal 2D to a creature.

cards.name: Fyre-Breath
cards.text: This creature gets +3 power and gains, “Before Fight: Deal 2D to each neighbor of the creature this creature fights.”

cards.name: Gargantes Scrapper
cards.text: Alpha. (You can only play this card before doing anything else this step.)Play: If you have 3A or more, deal 3D to an enemy creature.

cards.name: Gravelguts
cards.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Gravelguts, give Gravelguts two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Little Rapscal
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Creatures must fight when used, if able.

cards.name: Ogopogo
cards.text: After Ogopogo attacks and destroys a creature, you may deal 2D to a creature.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Play: If 3 or more enemy creatures have been destroyed this turn, your opponent loses 2A.

cards.name: Power of Fire
cards.text: Play: Sacrifice a friendly creature. If you do, each player loses A equal to half that creature’s power (rounding down the loss). Gain 1 chain.

cards.name: Ragwarg
cards.text: After a creature reaps, if it is the first time a creature has reaped this turn, deal 2D to it.

cards.name: Shattered Throne
cards.text: After a creature is used to fight, it captures 1A.

cards.name: Sköll
cards.text: Assault 3. (Before this creature attacks, deal 3D to the attacked enemy.)After an enemy creature is destroyed by Sköll’s assault damage, give a friendly creature a +1 power counter.

cards.name: Slimy Jark
cards.text: Skirmish. Elusive. Fight: Enrage the creature Slimy Jark fights.

cards.name: Smith
cards.text: Play: Gain 2A if you control more creatures than your opponent.

cards.name: The Flex
cards.text: Play: Choose a ready friendly Brobnar creature. Exhaust it and gain A equal to half its power (rounding down the gain).

cards.name: Barehanded
cards.text: Play: Put each artifact on top of its owner’s deck.

cards.name: Bellowing Patrizate
cards.text: While Bellowing Patrizate is ready, each creature takes 1D after it enters play.

cards.name: Cybergiant Rig
cards.text: This creature gains, “At the end of your turn, this creature loses a +1 power counter.”Play: Fully heal this creature and give it a +1 power counter for each damage healed.

cards.name: Forgemaster Og
cards.text: After a player forges a key, they lose all of their remaining A.

cards.name: Grumpus Tamer
cards.text: Reap: Search your deck and discard pile for a War Grumpus, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Guji Dinosaur Hunter
cards.text: Elusive. Action: Deal 2D to a creature. Deal 6D instead if it is a Dinosaur creature or has A on it.

cards.name: Igon the Green
cards.text: Destroyed: Purge Igon the Green. Return an Igon the Terrible from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Iron Obelisk
cards.text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1A for each friendly damaged Brobnar creature.

cards.name: Kaloch Stonefather
cards.text: While Kaloch Stonefather is in the center of your battleline, each friendly creature gains skirmish.

cards.name: Lava Ball
cards.text: Play: Deal 4D to a creature, with 2D splash.

cards.name: Mugwump
cards.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Mugwump, fully heal Mugwump and give it a +1 power counter.

cards.name: Nogi Smartfist
cards.text: Fight: Draw 2 cards. Discard 2 random cards from your hand.

cards.name: Old Boomy
cards.text: Reap: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Brobnar card or choose to stop. Deal 2D to Old Boomy if a Brobnar card was revealed. Archive each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Pile of Skulls
cards.text: Each time an enemy creature is destroyed during your turn, a friendly creature captures 1A.

cards.name: Ragnarok
cards.text: Alpha. Play: For the remainder of the turn, creatures cannot reap and you gain 1A whenever a friendly creature fights. At the end of the turn, destroy each creature.

cards.name: Rock-Hurling Giant
cards.text: During your turn, each time you discard a Brobnar card from your hand, you may deal 4D to a creature.

cards.name: Signal Fire
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Signal Fire. For the remainder of the turn, friendly Brobnar creatures may fight as though they belonged to the active house.

cards.name: The Big One
cards.text: After a creature is played, put a fuse counter on The Big One.If there are 10 or more fuse counters on The Big One, destroy each creature and artifact.

cards.name: The Floor is Lava
cards.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1D to a friendly creature and 1D to an enemy creature.

cards.name: War Grumpus
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Ready and fight with a neighboring Giant.

cards.name: Igon the Terrible
cards.text: Play: If Igon the Green has not been purged, destroy Igon the Terrible. Fight: Steal 1A.

cards.name: Mega Alaka
cards.text: If you have used a creature to fight this turn, Mega Alaka enters play ready.

cards.name: Mega Cowfyne
cards.text: Before Fight: Deal 2D to each neighbor of the creature Mega Cowfyne fights.

cards.name: Mega Ganger Chieftain
cards.text: Play: You may ready and fight with a neighboring creature.

cards.name: Mega Groke
cards.text: Fight: Your opponent loses 1A.

cards.name: Mega Gron Nine-Toes
cards.text: Mega Gron Nine-Toes gets +4 power while it is damaged. (Mega Gron Nine-Toes gets the power bonus only if he survives the damage.)

cards.name: Mega Mogghunter
cards.text: Fight: Deal 2D to a flank creature.

cards.name: Mega Narp
cards.text: Mega Narp’s neighbors cannot reap.

cards.name: Mega Shorty
cards.text: Assault 4. (Before this creature attacks, deal 4D to the attacked enemy.) Reap: Enrage Mega Shorty.

cards.name: Chieftain’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Cowfyne’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Groke’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Gron’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Mogghunter’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Narp’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Shorty’s Brew
cards.text: Play: Give a creature two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Binding Irons
cards.text: Play: Your opponent gains 3 chains.

cards.name: Buzzle
cards.text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Play/Fight: You may purge one of Buzzle’s neighbors. If you do, ready Buzzle.

cards.name: Dendrix
cards.text: Fight: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

cards.name: Draining Touch
cards.text: Play: Destroy a creature with no A on it.

cards.name: Etaromme
cards.text: Reap: Destroy a creature of the house with the most creatures in play.

cards.name: Exhume
cards.text: Play: Choose a creature in your discard pile. You may play that creature as if it belonged to the active house and was in your hand.

cards.name: Festering Touch
cards.text: Play: Choose up to 2 creatures. Deal 1D to each chosen creature. If that creature was already damaged, deal 3D instead.

cards.name: Harbinger of Doom
cards.text: Destroyed: Destroy each creature.

cards.name: Impspector
cards.text: Destroyed: Purge a random card from your opponent’s hand.

cards.name: Infurnace
cards.text: Play: Purge up to 2 cards from a discard pile. Your opponent loses A equal to the total Æmber bonus of the purged cards.

cards.name: Lilithal
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Capture 1A.

cards.name: Malison
cards.text: Fight: You may move an enemy creature anywhere in its controller’s battleline. Then, if it is on a flank, it captures 1A from its own side.

cards.name: Misery Exploit
cards.text: Play: Gain 1A for each damaged enemy creature.

cards.name: Not Finished with You
cards.text: Play: Shuffle any number of creatures from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Rotgrub
cards.text: Play: Your opponent loses 1A. Reap: Archive Rotgrub.

cards.name: The Evil Eye
cards.text: Play: Keys cost +3A during your opponent’s next turn.

cards.name: Bloodshard Imp
cards.text: After a creature reaps, its controller must sacrifice it.

cards.name: Borr Nit
cards.text: Reap: Reveal the top 5 cards of a player’s deck. Purge a card revealed this way. Shuffle the other revealed cards into that deck.

cards.name: Borr Nit’s Touch
cards.text: Play: Reveal the top 5 cards of a player’s deck. Purge a card revealed this way. Shuffle the other revealed cards into that deck.

cards.name: E’e on the Fringes
cards.text: Elusive. During your turn, after you discard a Dis card from your hand, you may purge a Dis card from a discard pile. If you do, steal 1A.

cards.name: Giants’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Giant creature.

cards.name: Gleeful Mayhem
cards.text: Play: For each house, deal 5D to a creature of that house.

cards.name: Hysteria
cards.text: Play: Return each creature to its owner’s hand.

cards.name: Library of the Damned
cards.text: Action: Archive a card.

cards.name: Obsidian Forge
cards.text: Action: Sacrifice any number of friendly creatures. Then, you may forge a key at +6A current cost, reduced by 1A for each creature sacrificed this way. If you do, destroy Obsidian Forge.

cards.name: Poltergeist
cards.text: Play: Use an artifact controlled by any player as if it were yours. Destroy that artifact.

cards.name: Skullion
cards.text: Play: Sacrifice a friendly creature.

cards.name: Snag
cards.text: Fight: Your opponent must choose the house of the creature Snag fights as their active house on their next turn.

cards.name: Soul Fiddle
cards.text: Action: Enrage a creature.

cards.name: Soulkeeper
cards.text: This creature gains, “Destroyed: Destroy the most powerful enemy creature.”

cards.name: Spyyyder
cards.text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Spyyyder gains poison while attacking an enemy flank creature.

cards.name: Three Fates
cards.text: Play: Destroy the 3 most powerful creatures.

cards.name: A Fair Game
cards.text: Play: Discard the top card of your opponent’s deck and reveal their hand. You gain 1A for each card of the discarded card’s house revealed this way. Your opponent repeats the preceding effect on you.

cards.name: Collar of Subordination
cards.text: You control this creature.

cards.name: Creeping Oblivion
cards.text: Play: Purge up to 2 cards from a discard pile.

cards.name: Eater of the Dead
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Purge a creature from a discard pile. If you do, put a +1 power counter on Eater of the Dead.

cards.name: Greater Oxtet
cards.text: Taunt. At the end of your “ready cards” step, purge a card from your hand. If you do, give Greater Oxtet two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Harvest Time
cards.text: Play: Choose a trait. Purge each card with that trait. Each player gains 1A for each card they controlled that was purged this way.

cards.name: Hecatomb
cards.text: Play: Destroy each Dis creature. Each player gains 1A for each creature they controlled that was destroyed this way.

cards.name: Key to Dis
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Key to Dis. Destroy each creature.

cards.name: Lesser Oxtet
cards.text: Elusive. Play: Purge each card in your hand. Reap: Keys cost +3A during your opponent’s next turn.

cards.name: Lord Invidius
cards.text: Elusive. While Lord Invidius is in the center of your battleline, it gains, “Reap: Take control of an enemy flank creature and exhaust it. While under your control, it belongs to house Dis.”

cards.name: Neffru
cards.text: Each time a creature is destroyed, its owner gains 1A.

cards.name: Noname
cards.text: Noname gets +1 power for each purged card. Play/Fight/Reap: Purge a card in a discard pile.

cards.name: Onyx Knight
cards.text: Play: Destroy each creature with odd power.

cards.name: Orb of Invidius
cards.text: After a creature reaps, stun it.

cards.name: Ortannu the Chained
cards.text: Reap: Return each copy of Ortannu’s Binding from your discard pile to your hand. For each one returned this way, deal 2D to a creature, with 2D splash.

cards.name: Sinestra
cards.text: After your opponent plays a creature on their left flank, they lose 1A.

cards.name: Snag’s Mirror
cards.text: After a player chooses an active house, their opponent cannot choose the same house as their active house on their next turn.

cards.name: Snaglet
cards.text: Elusive. Action: Choose a house. If your opponent chooses that house as their active house on their next turn, steal 2A.

cards.name: Soul Snatcher
cards.text: Each time a creature is destroyed, its owner gains 1A.

cards.name: Wretched Doll
cards.text: Action: If there is a doom counter in play, destroy all creatures with doom counters. Otherwise, put a doom counter on a creature.

cards.name: Ortannu’s Binding
cards.text: Play: Deal 2D to a friendly creature.

cards.name: Beasts’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Beast creature.

cards.name: Demons’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Demon creature.

cards.name: Dexus
cards.text: After your opponent plays a creature on their right flank, they lose 1A.

cards.name: Dinosaurs’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Dinosaur creature.

cards.name: Humans’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Human creature.

cards.name: Scientists’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Scientist creature.

cards.name: Thieves’ Bane
cards.text: Play: Destroy a Thief creature.

cards.name: Babbling Bibliophile
cards.text: Reap: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Cutthroat Research
cards.text: Play: Steal 2A if your opponent has 8A or more.

cards.name: Daughter
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)During your “draw cards” step, refill your hand to 1 additional card.

cards.name: EDAI “Edie” 4x4
cards.text: Play: Archive a card.Your opponent’s keys cost +1A for each card in your archives.

cards.name: Eyegor
cards.text: Play: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and discard the others.

cards.name: Hapsis
cards.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Hapsis, ward Hapsis and draw a card.

cards.name: Hologrammophone
cards.text: Action: Ward a creature.

cards.name: Information Exchange
cards.text: Play: Steal 1A. If your opponent stole A from you on their previous turn, steal 2A instead.

cards.name: Quant
cards.text: Reap: You may play one non-Logos action card this turn.

cards.name: Sanitation Engineer
cards.text: Hazardous 1. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 1D to the attacking enemy.)Reap: Discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Tautau Vapors
cards.text: Play: Draw 2 cards. Archive a card.

cards.name: Thorium Plasmate
cards.text: Play: Move an enemy creature anywhere in its controller’s battleline. Deal 2D to that creature for each of its neighbors that shares a house with it.

cards.name: Titan Guardian
cards.text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Destroyed: If Titan Guardian is not on a flank, draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Twin Bolt Emission
cards.text: Play: Deal 2D to a creature and deal 2D to a different creature.

cards.name: Wild Wormhole
cards.text: Play: Play the top card of your deck.

cards.name: Wormhole Technician
cards.text: Reap: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a Logos card, play it. Otherwise, archive it.

cards.name: Anomaly Exploiter
cards.text: Action: Destroy a damaged creature.

cards.name: C.Æ.N.D.L.E. Unit
cards.text: After an enemy creature reaps, draw a card.Action: Capture 1A.

cards.name: Code Monkey
cards.text: Deploy. (This creature can enter play anywhere in your battleline.)Play: Archive each neighboring creature. If those creatures share a house, gain 2A.

cards.name: Data Forge
cards.text: Play: You may forge a key at +10A current cost, reduced by 1A for each card in your hand.

cards.name: Discombobulator
cards.text: This creature gains, “Your A cannot be stolen.”

cards.name: Dr. Milli
cards.text: Play: For each creature your opponent controls in excess of you, not counting Dr. Milli, archive a card.

cards.name: Groupthink Tank
cards.text: Action: Deal 4D to each creature that shares a house with at least 1 of its neighbors.

cards.name: Interdimensional Graft
cards.text: Play: If an opponent forges a key on their next turn, they must give you their remaining A.

cards.name: Jargogle
cards.text: Elusive.Play: Put a card from your hand facedown under Jargogle.Destroyed: If it is your turn, play the card under Jargogle; otherwise, archive that card.

cards.name: Memory Chip
cards.text: After you choose Logos as your active house, archive a card.

cards.name: Mini Groupthink Tank
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: Deal 8D to a creature that shares a house with 2 of its neighbors.

cards.name: Positron Bolt
cards.text: Play: Deal 3D to a flank creature. Deal 2D to its neighbor. Deal 1D to the second creature’s other neighbor.

cards.name: Quantum Fingertrap
cards.text: Action: Swap the position of two creatures in a battleline.

cards.name: Reassembling Automaton
cards.text: Destroyed: If you have any other creatures in play, instead of destroying Reassembling Automaton, fully heal it, exhaust it, and move it to a flank.

cards.name: Remote Access
cards.text: Play: Use an opponent’s artifact as if it were yours.

cards.name: Seismo-entangler
cards.text: Action: Choose a house. During your opponent’s next turn, creatures of the chosen house cannot be used to reap.

cards.name: Academy Training
cards.text: If you control this creature, it belongs to house Logos. (Instead of its original house.)This creature gains, “Reap: Draw a card.”

cards.name: Chaos Portal
cards.text: Action: Choose a house. Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is of that house, play it.

cards.name: Crazy Killing Machine
cards.text: Action: Discard the top card of each player’s deck. For each of those cards, destroy a creature or artifact of that card’s house, if able. If 2 cards are not destroyed as a result of this, destroy Crazy Killing Machine.

cards.name: Dysania
cards.text: Play: Your opponent discards each of their archived cards. You gain 1A for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Entropic Swirl
cards.text: Play: Choose a creature, for each trait that creature has, deal it 2D and gain 1A.

cards.name: Fetchdrones
cards.text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. For each Logos card discarded this way, a friendly creature captures 2A.

cards.name: Hyde
cards.text: Reap: Draw a card. If you control Velum, draw 2 cards instead.Destroyed: Archive Velum from your discard pile. If you do, archive Hyde.

cards.name: Knowledge is Power
cards.text: Play: Choose one: Archive a card, or, for each archived card you have, gain 1A.

cards.name: Master the Theory
cards.text: Play: If there are no friendly creatures in play, you may archive a card for each enemy creature.

cards.name: Mimic Gel
cards.text: Mimic Gel cannot be played unless there is another creature in play.Mimic Gel enters play as a copy of another creature in play, except it belongs to house Logos.

cards.name: Neutron Shark
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: Destroy an enemy creature or artifact and a friendly creature or artifact. Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is not a Logos card, trigger this effect again.

cards.name: Pocket Universe
cards.text: You may spend A on Pocket Universe when forging keys.Action: Move 1A from your pool to Pocket Universe.

cards.name: Prescriptive Grammarbot
cards.text: Taunt. Hazardous 3. Reap: Enrage a creature.

cards.name: Replicator
cards.text: Reap: Trigger the reap effect of another creature in play as if you controlled that creature. (That creature does not exhaust.)

cards.name: Scientifical Hack
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Scientifical Hack. For the remainder of the turn, you may use friendly artifacts as if they belonged to the active house.

cards.name: Self-Bolstering Automata
cards.text: Destroyed: If you have any other creatures in play, instead of destroying Self-Bolstering Automata, fully heal it, exhaust it, and move it to a flank. If you do, give it two +1 power counters.

cards.name: Strange Gizmo
cards.text: After you forge a key, destroy each creature and artifact.

cards.name: Universal Keylock
cards.text: Keys cost +3A.After a player forges a key, destroy Universal Keylock.

cards.name: Universal Recycle Bin
cards.text: Action: Archive a purged card you own.

cards.name: Zenzizenzizenzic
cards.text: During your “draw cards” step, if Zenzizenzizenzic is in the center of your battleline, refill your hand to 2 additional cards.

cards.name: Velum
cards.text: Reap: Archive a card. If you control Hyde, archive 2 cards instead.Destroyed: Archive Hyde from your discard pile. If you do, archive Velum.

cards.name: Axiom of Grisk
cards.text: Play: Ward a creature. Destroy each creature with no A on it. Gain 2 chains.

cards.name: Brutodon Auxiliary
cards.text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Hazardous 2. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 2D to the attacking enemy.)

cards.name: Chant of Hubris
cards.text: Play: Move 1 A from a creature to another creature.

cards.name: Imperial Scutum
cards.text: This creature gets +2 armor and gains, “Destroyed: Move each A on this creature to the common supply.”

cards.name: Imperium
cards.text: Play: Ward 2 friendly creatures.

cards.name: Legatus Raptor
cards.text: Fight: You may exalt Legatus Raptor. If you do, ready and use another friendly creature.

cards.name: Odoac the Patrician
cards.text: Play: Capture 1A. While Odoac the Patrician has A on it, your A cannot be stolen.

cards.name: Phalanx Strike
cards.text: Play: Choose a creature. Deal 1D to it for each friendly creature. You may exalt a friendly creature to repeat the preceding effect.

cards.name: Praefectus Ludo
cards.text: Each other friendly creature gains, “Destroyed: Move each A on this creature to the common supply.”

cards.name: Questor Jarta
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: You may exalt Questor Jarta. If you do, gain 1A.

cards.name: Rhetor Gallim
cards.text: Play: Your opponent’s keys cost +3A during their next turn. Reap: You may exalt Rhetor Gallim. If you do, your opponent’s keys cost +3A during their next turn.

cards.name: Senator Shrix
cards.text: You may spend A on Senator Shrix as if it were in your pool.Play/Reap: You may exalt Senator Shrix.

cards.name: The Golden Spiral
cards.text: Action: Exalt a friendly creature. Ready and use that creature.

cards.name: Thero Centurion
cards.text: Play/Fight: Capture 1A.

cards.name: Tribute
cards.text: Play: The most powerful friendly creature captures 2A. You may exalt that creature to repeat the preceding effect.

cards.name: Tricerian Legionary
cards.text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Play: Ward a friendly creature.

cards.name: Ancient Power
cards.text: Play: Ward each friendly creature with A on it.

cards.name: Centurion Stenopius
cards.text: Centurion Stenopius gets +3 power for each A on it.Play/Fight/Reap: You may exalt Centurion Stenopius.

cards.name: City-State Interest
cards.text: Play: Each friendly creature captures 1A.

cards.name: Draco Praeco
cards.text: Reap: You may exalt Draco Praeco. If you do, choose a house. Enrage each creature of that house.

cards.name: Exile
cards.text: Play: Give control of a friendly creature to your opponent.

cards.name: Gargantodon
cards.text: Gargantodon enters play stunned.Gargantodon only deals 4D when fighting.Each A that would be stolen is captured by a creature controlled by the active player instead.

cards.name: Library of Polliasaurus
cards.text: Action: Move 1A from a friendly creature to your pool.

cards.name: Orator Hissaro
cards.text: Deploy. Play: Ready and exalt each of Orator Hissaro’s neighbors. For the remainder of the turn, they belong to house Saurian.

cards.name: Paraguardian
cards.text: Reap: You may exalt Paraguardian. If you do, ward each of its neighbors.

cards.name: Philophosaurus
cards.text: Reap: You may look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Archive 1, add 1 to your hand, and discard 1.

cards.name: Regrettable Meteor
cards.text: Play: Destroy each Dinosaur creature and each creature with power 6 or higher.

cards.name: Sic Semper Tyrannosaurus
cards.text: Play: Move each A from the most powerful creature to your pool and destroy that creature.

cards.name: Stomp
cards.text: Play: Deal 5D to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, exalt a friendly creature.

cards.name: Terrordactyl
cards.text: Terrordactyl enters play stunned.Terrordactyl only deals 4D when fighting.Before Fight: Deal 4D to each neighbor of the creature Terrordactyl fights.

cards.name: The Callipygian Ideal
cards.text: Play: Exalt this creature.This creature gains, “You may spend A on this creature as if it were in your pool.”

cards.name: Tribune Pompitus
cards.text: Each friendly creature gets +2 power for each A on it.Before Fight: You may exalt Tribune Pompitus.

cards.name: Auto-Legionary
cards.text: Action: Put Auto-Legionary on a flank of your battleline. While in the battleline, it is considered a creature with 5 power and belongs to all houses.

cards.name: Cincinnatus Rex
cards.text: If there are no enemy creatures, destroy Cincinnatus Rex.Fight: You may exalt Cincinnatus Rex. If you do, ready each other friendly card.

cards.name: City Gates
cards.text: Action: A friendly creature captures 1A. If that creature is a Dinosaur, it captures 2A instead.

cards.name: Crassosaurus
cards.text: Elusive.Play: Capture 10A from any combination of players. Then, if Crassosaurus has fewer than 10A on it, purge Crassosaurus.

cards.name: Diplo-Macy
cards.text: Alpha. Play: Until the start of your next turn, each creature gains, “Before Fight: Exalt this creature.”

cards.name: Favor of Rex
cards.text: Play: Trigger the play effect of a creature as if you had just played it.

cards.name: Good of the Many
cards.text: Play: Destroy each creature that does not share a trait with another creature in its controller’s battleline.

cards.name: Grimlocus Dux
cards.text: Taunt.Play: Exalt Grimlocus Dux twice.

cards.name: Imperial Forge
cards.text: Play: Forge a key at +8A current cost, reduced by 1A for each A on friendly creatures.

cards.name: Imperial Road
cards.text: Omni: Play a Saurian creature. That creature enters play stunned.

cards.name: Kompsos Haruspex
cards.text: Each friendly creature’s play effect is a play/reap effect.

cards.name: Livia the Elder
cards.text: Reap: You may exalt Livia the Elder. If you do, each friendly creature’s fight effects and reap effects are fight/reap effects for the remainder of the turn.

cards.name: Primus Unguis
cards.text: Each friendly creature gets +2 power for each A on Primus Unguis.Reap: Exalt Primus Unguis.

cards.name: Saurus Rex
cards.text: Fight/Reap: If Saurus Rex is in the center of your battleline, you may exalt it. If you do, search your deck for a Saurian card, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Saury About That
cards.text: Play: Destroy a creature. Its controller gains 1A.

cards.name: Senator Bracchus
cards.text: You may spend A on friendly creatures as if it were in your pool.Fight/Reap: Exalt Senator Bracchus.

cards.name: Sow Salt
cards.text: Alpha. Play: Until the start of your next turn, creatures cannot be used to reap.

cards.name: Spartasaur
cards.text: After a friendly creature is destroyed, destroy each non-Dinosaur creature.Fight: Gain 2A.

cards.name: Tertiate
cards.text: Play: Destroy one third of all enemy creatures and one third of all friendly creatures (rounding up each time).

cards.name: The Colosseum
cards.text: After an enemy creature is destroyed while fighting, put a glory counter on The Colosseum.Omni: If there are 6 or more glory counters on The Colosseum, remove 6 and forge a key at current cost.

cards.name: Triumph
cards.text: Play: If there are no enemy creatures, exalt each friendly creature. If you do and there are 6 or more friendly creatures, forge a key at no cost.

cards.name: A. Vinda
cards.text: Reap: Deal 1D to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

cards.name: Bad Penny
cards.text: Destroyed: Return Bad Penny to your hand.

cards.name: Breaker Hill
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Each of Breaker Hill’s neighbors gains, “Action: Steal 1A.”

cards.name: Hit and Run
cards.text: Play: Deal 2D to a creature. Return a friendly creature to your hand.

cards.name: Hock
cards.text: Play: Destroy an artifact. If you do, gain 1A.

cards.name: Hugger-Mugger
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play: Capture 1A. Then, if your opponent has more forged keys than you, steal 1A.

cards.name: Inky Gloom
cards.text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to reap on their next turn.

cards.name: J. Vinda
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Reap: Deal 1D to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, steal 1A.

cards.name: Kymoor Eclipse
cards.text: Play: Shuffle each flank creature into its owner’s deck.

cards.name: Mug
cards.text: Play: Move 1A from a creature to your pool. Deal 2D to that creature.

cards.name: Pestering Blow
cards.text: Play: Deal 1D to a creature and enrage it.

cards.name: Ronnie Wristclocks
cards.text: Play: Steal 1A. If your opponent has 7A or more, steal 2A instead.

cards.name: Symon
cards.text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Put the creature Symon fights on top of its owner’s deck.

cards.name: Trust No One
cards.text: Play: Steal 1A. If there are no friendly creatures in play, instead steal 1A for each house represented among enemy creatures (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: Umbra
cards.text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)Fight: Steal 1A.

cards.name: Yantzee Gang
cards.text: Action: Steal 1A.

cards.name: Brend the Fanatic
cards.text: Skirmish.Play: Your opponent gains 1A.Destroyed: Steal 3A.

cards.name: Chain Gang
cards.text: After you play Subtle Chain, ready Chain Gang. Action: Steal 1A. Shuffle a Subtle Chain from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Duskrunner
cards.text: This creature gains, “Reap: Steal 1A.”

cards.name: Fidgit
cards.text: Elusive.Reap: Discard a random card from your opponent’s archives or the top card of their deck. If that card is an action, play it as if it were yours.

cards.name: Hidden Stash
cards.text: Play: Archive a card.

cards.name: Into the Night
cards.text: Play: Until the start of your next turn, non-Shadows creatures cannot be used to fight.

cards.name: No Safety in Numbers
cards.text: Play: Deal 3D to each creature that belongs to a house that has 3 or more creatures in play.

cards.name: Oubliette
cards.text: Play: Purge a creature with power 3 or lower.

cards.name: Skeleton Key
cards.text: Action: A friendly creature captures 1A.

cards.name: Special Delivery
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Special Delivery. Deal 3D to a flank creature. If this damage destroys that creature, purge it.

cards.name: Spike Trap
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Spike Trap. If you do, deal 3D to each flank creature.

cards.name: Subtle Chain
cards.text: Play: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

cards.name: Subtle Maul
cards.text: Action: Your opponent discards a random card from their hand.

cards.name: Too Much to Protect
cards.text: Play: Steal all but 6 of your opponent’s A.

cards.name: Whisper
cards.text: Elusive. Action: Lose 1A. If you do, destroy a creature.

cards.name: Customs Office
cards.text: Your opponent must pay you 1A in order to play an artifact.

cards.name: Finch Cloak
cards.text: Fight/Reap: If you have less A than your opponent, steal 1A. Otherwise, each player gains 1A.

cards.name: Gambling Den
cards.text: At the start of each player’s turn, that player may name a house. If they do, reveal the top card of their deck. If it is of the named house, they gain 2A. Otherwise, they lose 2A.

cards.name: Hunter or Hunted?
cards.text: Play: Ward a creature, or move a ward from a creature to another creature.

cards.name: Key of Darkness
cards.text: Play: Forge a key at +6A current cost. If your opponent has no A, forge a key at +2A current cost instead.

cards.name: Keyforgery
cards.text: When your opponent would forge a key, that player names a house. Reveal a random card from your hand. If that card is not of the named house, destroy Keyforgery and they do not forge that key (no A is spent).

cards.name: Lethal Distraction
cards.text: Play: Choose a creature. For the remainder of the turn, whenever this creature takes damage, it takes an additional 2D.

cards.name: Longfused Mines
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Longfused Mines. Deal 3D to each enemy creature not on a flank.

cards.name: Mack the Knife
cards.text: Elusive.You may use Mack the Knife as if it belonged to the active house.Action: Deal 1D to a creature. If this damage destroys that creature, gain 1A.

cards.name: Manchego
cards.text: Play: If you have 5 or fewer cards in your deck, steal 2A.Fight/Reap: You may shuffle Manchego into your deck.

cards.name: Rigged Lottery
cards.text: Play: Each player discards the top 5 cards of their deck. For each Shadows card discarded, its owner gains 1A.

cards.name: Ring of Invisibility
cards.text: This creature gains elusive and skirmish.

cards.name: Sack of Coins
cards.text: Play: Deal 1D to a creature for each A in your pool.

cards.name: Scowly Caper
cards.text: Skirmish.Scowly Caper enters play under your opponent’s control and can be used as if it belonged to any house.At the end of your turn, destroy one of Scowly Caper’s neighbors.

cards.name: Selwyn the Fence
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Move 1A from one of your cards to your pool.

cards.name: Sneklifter
cards.text: Play: Take control of an enemy artifact. While under your control, if it does not belong to one of your three houses, it is considered to be of house Shadows.

cards.name: The Quiet Anvil
cards.text: Keys cost –2A.After a player forges a key, destroy The Quiet Anvil.

cards.name: The Shadow Council
cards.text: Elusive. While The Shadow Council is in the center of your battleline, it gains, “Action: Steal 2A.”

cards.name: Treasure Map
cards.text: Play: If you have not played any other cards this turn, gain 3A. For the remainder of the turn, you cannot play cards.

cards.name: Weasand
cards.text: Deploy. Elusive. If Weasand is on a flank, destroy it. After a player forges a key, gain 2A.

cards.name: Brobnar Plant
cards.text: Elusive.After a player chooses Brobnar as their active house, gain 1A.

cards.name: Dis Plant
cards.text: Elusive.After a player chooses Dis as their active house, gain 1A.

cards.name: Logos Plant
cards.text: Elusive.After a player chooses Logos as their active house, gain 1A.

cards.name: Saurian Plant
cards.text: Elusive.After a player chooses Saurian as their active house, gain 1A.

cards.name: Star Alliance Plant
cards.text: Elusive.After a player chooses Star Alliance as their active house, gain 1A.

cards.name: Untamed Plant
cards.text: Elusive.After a player chooses Untamed as their active house, gain 1A.

cards.name: Armsmaster Molina
cards.text: Hazardous 3. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 3D to the attacking enemy.)Each of Armsmaster Molina’s neighbors gains hazardous 3.

cards.name: Chief Engineer Walls
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Play/Fight/Reap: You may return an upgrade or Robot card from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Cloaking Dongle
cards.text: This creature and each of its neighbors gains elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)

cards.name: Com. Officer Kirby
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: You may play a non-Star Alliance artifact, upgrade, or action card this turn.

cards.name: Commander Chan
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Use another friendly creature.

cards.name: Explo-rover
cards.text: Skirmish.Explo-rover may be played as an upgrade instead of a creature, with the text: “This creature gains skirmish.”

cards.name: First Officer Frane
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: A friendly creature captures 1A.

cards.name: Lieutenant Khrkhar
cards.text: Taunt. (This creature’s neighbors cannot be attacked unless they have taunt.)Hazardous 3. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 3D to the attacking enemy.)

cards.name: Light of the Archons
cards.text: This creature gets +1 power and +1 armor for each upgrade attached to it.

cards.name: Medic Ingram
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: You may heal 3 damage from a creature and ward it.

cards.name: Molina’s Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Molina’s Blaster to Armsmaster Molina.”After you attach Molina’s Blaster to Armsmaster Molina, you may deal 3D to a creature.

cards.name: Red Alert
cards.text: Play: If there are more enemy creatures than friendly creatures, deal damage to each enemy creature equal to the difference.

cards.name: Sci. Officer Qincan
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)After a player chooses an active house which matches no cards in play, steal 1A.

cards.name: Sensor Chief Garcia
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: Keys cost +2A during your opponent’s next turn.

cards.name: Stealth Mode
cards.text: Play: Your opponent cannot play action cards during their next turn.

cards.name: Zap
cards.text: Play: Deal 1D to a creature for each house represented among creatures in play.

cards.name: CALV-1N
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Draw a card. CALV-1N may be played as an upgrade instead of a creature, with the text: “This creature gains, ‘Fight/Reap: Draw a card.’”

cards.name: CXO Taber
cards.text: Fight/Reap: You may play or use one non-Star Alliance card this turn.

cards.name: Force Field
cards.text: This creature gains, “Reap: Ward this creature.”

cards.name: Helmsman Spears
cards.text: Fight/Reap: Discard any number of cards from your hand. Draw a card for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Information Officer Gray
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: You may reveal a non-Star Alliance card from your hand. If you do, archive it.

cards.name: Lay of the Land
cards.text: Play: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order. Draw a card.

cards.name: Navigator Ali
cards.text: Play/Fight/Reap: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.

cards.name: Nurse Soto
cards.text: Deploy. (This creature can enter play anywhere in your battleline.)Play/Fight/Reap: Heal 3 damage from each of Nurse Soto’s neighbors.

cards.name: Quadracorder
cards.text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1A for each house represented among friendly creatures (to a maximum of 3).

cards.name: Quintrino Flux
cards.text: Play: Choose a friendly creature and an enemy creature. Destroy the chosen creatures and each creature with the same power as either of the chosen creatures.

cards.name: Sci. Officer Morpheus
cards.text: After you play a creature with a play effect, trigger its play effect an additional time.

cards.name: Stunner
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may stun a creature.”

cards.name: Tactical Officer Moon
cards.text: Assault 2. (Before this creature attacks, deal 2D to the attacked enemy.) Play: You may rearrange the creatures in a player’s battleline.

cards.name: Transporter Platform
cards.text: Action: Return a friendly creature and each upgrade attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Universal Translator
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: Use a friendly non-Star Alliance creature.”

cards.name: Xenotraining
cards.text: Play: For each house represented among friendly creatures, a friendly creature captures 1A.

cards.name: Æmbertracker
cards.text: Play: Deal 2D to each enemy creature with A on it. This damage cannot be prevented by armor.

cards.name: Book of leQ
cards.text: Action: Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a non-Star Alliance card, its house becomes your active house. Otherwise, end your turn.

cards.name: Captain Val Jericho
cards.text: During your turn, if Captain Val Jericho is in the center of your battleline, you may play one card that is not of the active house.

cards.name: Crash Muldoon
cards.text: Deploy. Crash Muldoon enters play ready. Action: Use a neighboring non-Star Alliance creature.

cards.name: Disruption Field
cards.text: Your opponent’s keys cost +1A for each disruption counter on Disruption Field.This creature gains “Fight/Reap: Put a disruption counter on Disruption Field.”

cards.name: Doctor Driscoll
cards.text: Elusive. Action: Heal 2 damage from a creature. Gain 1A for each damage healed this way.

cards.name: Encounter Suit
cards.text: After an action card is played but before it resolves, ward this creature.

cards.name: Forging an Alliance
cards.text: Play: Forge a key at +7A current cost, reduced by 1A (to a maximum of 6) for each house represented among cards in play.

cards.name: Galactic Census
cards.text: Play: If there are exactly 3 or exactly 4 houses represented among creatures in play, gain 1A. If there are exactly 5, gain 2A. If there are 6 or more, gain 3A.

cards.name: General Order 24
cards.text: At the start of each player’s turn, they must choose a creature they control and destroy each creature of the chosen creature’s house. If that player has no creatures in play, destroy General Order 24 instead.

cards.name: Operations Officer Yshi
cards.text: Taunt. Each of Operations Officer Yshi’s neighbors gains, “Fight/Reap: Capture 1A.”

cards.name: Peace Accord
cards.text: Play: Each player gains 2A. After a creature is used to fight, its controller loses 4A. Destroy Peace Accord.

cards.name: Plasma Nozzle
cards.text: This creature gains, “Before Fight: Deal 2D to the attacked creature, with 2D splash.”

cards.name: Psionic Officer Lang
cards.text: After an enemy creature reaps, archive the top card of your deck.

cards.name: Quixxle Stone
cards.text: If a player has more creatures in play than their opponent, they cannot play creatures.

cards.name: Special Agent "Fingers"
cards.text: Elusive. Action: Steal 1A.

cards.name: Tachyon Pulse
cards.text: Play: Destroy each artifact. Exhaust each creature with an upgrade.

cards.name: Techivore Pulpate
cards.text: After a player chooses an active house, destroy each artifact of that house.

cards.name: Uncharted Lands
cards.text: Play: Place 6A from the common supply on Uncharted Lands. Each Star Alliance creature gains, “Reap: Move 1A from Uncharted Lands to your pool.”

cards.name: United Action
cards.text: Alpha.Play: For the remainder of the turn, you may play cards from any house for which you have a card in play. You cannot use cards this turn.

cards.name: We Can ALL Win
cards.text: Play: Each player’s keys cost –2A until the end of your next turn.

cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Frane’s Blaster to First Officer Frane.”After you attach Frane’s Blaster to First Officer Frane, move each A from First Officer Frane to your pool.

cards.name: Garcia’s Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Garcia’s Blaster to Sensor Chief Garcia.”After you attach Garcia’s Blaster to Sensor Chief Garcia, steal 1A.

cards.name: Ingram’s Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Ingram’s Blaster to Medic Ingram.” After you attach Ingram’s Blaster to Medic Ingram, fully heal a creature.

cards.name: Khrkhar’s Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Khrkhar’s Blaster to Lieutenant Khrkhar.”After you attach Khrkhar’s Blaster to Lieutenant Khrkhar, ward Lieutenant Khrkhar.

cards.name: Kirby’s Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Kirby’s Blaster to Com. Officer Kirby.”After you attach Kirby’s Blaster to Com. Officer Kirby, draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Qincan’s Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Qincan’s Blaster to Sci. Officer Qincan.”After you attach Qincan’s Blaster to Sci. Officer Qincan, you may archive a creature in play.

cards.name: Walls’ Blaster
cards.text: This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: You may deal 2D to a creature, or attach Walls’ Blaster to Chief Engineer Walls.”After you attach Walls’ Blaster to Chief Engineer Walls, stun a creature for each upgrade on Chief Engineer Walls.

cards.name: Bramble Lynx
cards.text: Skirmish. (When you use this creature to fight, it is dealt no damage in return.)If you have used a creature to reap this turn, Bramble Lynx enters play ready.

cards.name: Cauldron Boil
cards.text: Play: Deal damage to each creature equal to the amount of damage on that creature.

cards.name: Deepwood Druid
cards.text: Deploy. (This creature can enter play anywhere in your battleline.)Play/Reap: Fully heal a neighboring creature.

cards.name: Ghosthawk

cards.name: Harmonia
cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)After you play a creature, if there are more enemy creatures than friendly creatures, gain 1A.

cards.text: Elusive. (The first time this creature is attacked each turn, no damage is dealt.)Your keys cost –1A.

cards.name: Key Charge
cards.text: Play: Lose 1A. If you do, you may forge a key at current cost.

cards.name: Molephin
cards.text: Hazardous 3. (Before this creature is attacked, deal 3D to the attacking enemy.) After A is stolen from you, deal 1D to each enemy creature for each A stolen.

cards.name: Musthic Murmook

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Play: Return a creature from your discard pile to your hand.

cards.name: Rustgnawer
cards.text: Fight: Destroy an artifact. If that artifact had an Æmber bonus, you gain that much A.

cards.name: Song of the Wild
cards.text: Play: For the remainder of the turn, each friendly creature gains, “Reap: Gain 1A.”

cards.name: Tantadlin
cards.text: Tantadlin only deals 2D when fighting.Fight: Discard a random card from your opponent’s archives.

cards.name: The Fittest
cards.text: Play: Give each friendly creature a +1 power counter.

cards.name: Unnatural Selection
cards.text: Play: Choose 3 friendly creatures and 3 enemy creatures. Destroy each other creature.

cards.name: Unsuspecting Prey
cards.text: Play: Deal 2D to up to 3 undamaged creatures.

cards.name: Camouflage
cards.text: Creatures not on a flank cannot fight this creature.

cards.name: Fangtooth Cavern
cards.text: At the end of your turn, destroy the least powerful creature.

cards.name: Flaxia
cards.text: Play: Gain 2A if you control more creatures than your opponent.

cards.name: Fogbank
cards.text: Play: Your opponent cannot use creatures to fight on their next turn.

cards.name: Gebuk

cards.name: Grasping Vines
cards.text: Play: Return up to 3 artifacts to their owners’ hands.

cards.name: Instrument of Silence

cards.name: Kangaphant

cards.name: Mimicry

cards.name: Nature’s Call
cards.text: Play: Return up to 3 creatures to their owners’ hands.

cards.name: Panpaca, Anga

cards.text: After a player chooses an active house, that player destroys an artifact of that house.

cards.text: Play/Reap: Deal 2D to each other creature.

cards.text: Elusive. Hazardous 6. Poison. Skirmish.

cards.name: Toad

cards.text: This creature gains invulnerable. (It cannot be destroyed or dealt damage.)This creature gains, “Fight/Reap: Archive Ghostform.”

cards.name: Infomancer
cards.text: Elusive.Play: Graft an action card from your hand onto Infomancer. (Place it faceup under this card.)Reap: Trigger the play effect of an action card grafted onto Infomancer.

cards.name: Lateral Shift
cards.text: Play: Look at your opponent’s hand. Play a card from that hand as if it were yours.

cards.name: Memolith
cards.text: Action: Graft an action card from your hand onto Memolith (place it faceup under this card), or trigger the play effect of an action card grafted onto Memolith.

cards.name: Nizak, The Forgotten
cards.text: While fighting, Nizak, The Forgotten gains invulnerable. (It cannot be destroyed or dealt damage.)After an enemy creature is destroyed fighting Nizak, The Forgotten, return that creature to its owner’s hand.

cards.name: Orb of Wonder
cards.text: Omni: Sacrifice Orb of Wonder. If you do, search your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: The Grim Reaper
cards.text: If you are haunted, The Grim Reaper enters play ready. (You are haunted if there are 10 or more cards in your discard pile.)Reap: Purge an enemy creature and a friendly creature.

cards.name: The Red Baron
cards.text: While your red key is forged, The Red Baron gains, “Reap: Steal 1A.” While your opponent’s red key is forged, The Red Baron gains elusive.

cards.name: Timequake
cards.text: Play: Shuffle each friendly card in play into your deck. Draw a card for each card shuffled into your deck this way.

cards.name: Valoocanth
cards.text: While the tide is low, Valoocanth cannot be used. (By default, the tide is neither high or low.)Fight/Reap: Exhaust an enemy creature and each of its neighbors.
